intro: Eupatorium pseudoglomeratum, commonly known as purple false dragonhead, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy purple to violet flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Eupatorium pseudoglomeratum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
